Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with immigration status requirements
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Does the applicant meet the tri-partite test for a stay of removal?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant failed to provide credible evidence of risk upon return to Kenya; claims assessed multiple times with consistent findings of no significant risk.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Repeated attempts to delay removal without new or compelling evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged risk upon return to Kenya
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tri-partite test for stay of removal
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of risk claims, country conditions in Kenya
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to removal orders and stays
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Prior decisions, country condition reports, applicant’s submissions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Lack of documentary support for claimed risks
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Interim stay of removal pending further review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Tri-partite test: (1) serious issue to be tried, (2) irreparable harm, (3) balance of convenience
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No new or compelling evidence provided
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration Division of the Immigration and Refugee Board
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's failure to comply with immigration status and repeated delay tactics
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Reviewed and rejected due to lack of credibility and corroboration
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 24(1) of IRPA (illegal entry or presence)
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of IRB to grant stays
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Claims inconsistent with country reports and prior findings
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Applicant failed all three parts of the tri-partite test
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Tri-partite test for stay of removal

Crimes.Violation_Type: Remaining in Canada beyond authorized period
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Does the applicant meet the tri-partite test for a stay of removal?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa and filed multiple stay motions without credible evidence of risk upon return.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Filed multiple legal motions to delay removal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of harm upon return to Kenya
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tri-partite test for stay of removal
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of claims, country condition stability
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections on removal and temporary resident permits
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Repeated applications for stay without new evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims not supported by evidence or country reports
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Public country condition reports, applicant’s affidavits
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds, risk on return
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Lack of documentary support; inconsistency with public information
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Tri-partite test: (1) serious issue to be tried, (2) irreparable harm, (3) balance of convenience
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No corroborating documents or updated evidence
Crimes.Cause_Description: Overstaying visa and attempting to delay removal through repetitive litigation
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Evaluated and rejected due to lack of credibility
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Jurisdiction of IRB over stay applications
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Findings inconsistent with objective country evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Failure to meet any prong of the tri-partite test
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of credible and material evidence
